## TASK 1: Games Language Expansion (10+ Languages)

### 1.1 Language Picker UX (Scalable Drawer)

Instead of a crowded toggle bar, we use a **bottom drawer** that displays language mastery progress.

**Interaction:** The user taps the current language flag/code in the top header. A drawer slides up.
**Visuals:** Grid layout. Active language has a glowing Burnt Orange border.

**Component: `LanguageSelector.tsx`**

```tsx
import { motion, AnimatePresence } from "framer-motion";
import { Check, Lock } from "lucide-react";

interface LanguageSelectorProps {
  isOpen: boolean;
  onClose: () => void;
  currentLang: LanguageCode;
  onSelect: (lang: LanguageCode) => void;
  userProgress: Record<LanguageCode, number>; // 0-100 mastery
}

export const LanguageSelector = ({ isOpen, onClose, currentLang, onSelect, userProgress }: LanguageSelectorProps) => {
  return (
    <AnimatePresence>
      {isOpen && (
        <>
          {/* Backdrop */}
          <motion.div
            initial={{ opacity: 0 }}
            animate={{ opacity: 1 }}
            exit={{ opacity: 0 }}
            onClick={onClose}
            className="fixed inset-0 z-40 bg-black/60 backdrop-blur-sm"
          />
          
          {/* Drawer */}
          <motion.div
            initial={{ y: "100%" }}
            animate={{ y: 0 }}
            exit={{ y: "100%" }}
            transition={{ type: "spring", damping: 30, stiffness: 300 }}
            className="fixed bottom-0 left-0 right-0 z-50 rounded-t-3xl bg-surface border-t border-secondary/10 p-6 max-h-[85vh] overflow-y-auto"
          >
            <div className="w-12 h-1.5 bg-secondary/20 rounded-full mx-auto mb-6" />
            
            <h2 className="font-display text-2xl text-secondary mb-6 text-center">
              Pick your path
            </h2>

            <div className="grid grid-cols-2 gap-4">
              {Object.values(LANGUAGES).map((lang) => {
                const isActive = currentLang === lang.code;
                const progress = userProgress[lang.code] || 0;
                
                return (
                  <button
                    key={lang.code}
                    onClick={() => {
                      onSelect(lang.code);
                      onClose();
                    }}
                    className={`
                      relative flex flex-col items-center p-4 rounded-2xl border transition-all
                      ${isActive 
                        ? "bg-primary/10 border-primary shadow-[0_0_15px_-3px_rgba(211,97,53,0.3)]" 
                        : "bg-background border-secondary/10 hover:border-secondary/30"}
                    `}
                  >
                    {/* "Flag" Representation: Minimalist ISO Code */}
                    <div className={`
                      w-12 h-12 rounded-full flex items-center justify-center text-lg font-bold mb-3
                      ${isActive ? "bg-primary text-secondary" : "bg-surface text-secondary/60"}
                    `}>
                      {lang.code.toUpperCase()}
                    </div>

                    <span className="font-body font-semibold text-secondary text-sm">
                      {lang.nativeName}
                    </span>
                    <span className="font-body text-xs text-secondary/50 mb-3">
                      {lang.englishName}
                    </span>

                    {/* Progress Bar */}
                    <div className="w-full h-1.5 bg-background rounded-full overflow-hidden">
                      <div 
                        className="h-full bg-accent" 
                        style={{ width: `${progress}%` }} 
                      />
                    </div>
                  </button>
                );
              })}
            </div>
          </motion.div>
        </>
      )}
    </AnimatePresence>
  );
};
```

### 1.2 CJK Adaptations & Word Ladder Mechanic

**Problem:** Word Ladder (Cat â†’ Cot â†’ Cog â†’ Dog) relies on changing a single phonetic letter. This breaks in Chinese/Japanese.

**Solution:**

**Grid Sizing:** CJK characters are denser.
- Latin/Germanic: `gap-2`, `text-3xl`
- CJK: `gap-3`, `text-4xl` (Visual weight adjustment)

**Mechanic Swap:** For CJK, the game morphs into **"Compound Bridge"**.
- Start: "ç”µ" (Electric)
- Step 1: "ç”µè¯" (Telephone - keep 'Electric', add 'Talk')
- Step 2: "è°ˆè¯" (Conversation - keep 'Talk', change 'Electric' to 'Chat')
- Step 3: "è°ˆå¿ƒ" (Heart-to-heart - keep 'Chat', change 'Talk' to 'Heart')

**Code Implementation (Tile Component):**

```tsx
interface TileProps {
  char: string;
  state: 'idle' | 'active' | 'correct' | 'wrong';
  isCJK: boolean;
}

const Tile = ({ char, state, isCJK }: TileProps) => {
  // Dynamic Text Sizing
  const textSize = isCJK ? "text-4xl font-medium" : "text-3xl font-bold uppercase";
  const padding = isCJK ? "p-1" : "p-2"; // CJK chars are square, need less horiz padding

  const variants = {
    idle: "bg-surface border-secondary/10 text-secondary",
    active: "bg-surface border-primary text-primary ring-2 ring-primary/30",
    correct: "bg-accent border-accent text-white",
    wrong: "bg-red-900/50 border-red-500 text-red-200"
  };

  return (
    <motion.div
      layout
      initial={{ scale: 0.8, opacity: 0 }}
      animate={{ scale: 1, opacity: 1 }}
      className={`
        ${textSize} ${padding} ${variants[state]}
        w-16 h-16 rounded-xl border-2 flex items-center justify-center
        shadow-lg backdrop-blur-md select-none cursor-pointer
        font-body transition-colors duration-200
      `}
    >
      {char}
    </motion.div>
  );
};
```

### 1.3 Flag Representation Solution

**No flags for Chinese.** Use minimalist ISO code circles (`ZH` in a rounded-full circle) instead of ðŸ‡¨ðŸ‡³/ðŸ‡¹ðŸ‡¼. This sidesteps the controversy entirely while maintaining the clean aesthetic. JA/KO can optionally use ðŸ‡¯ðŸ‡µ/ðŸ‡°ðŸ‡· since those are less contentious.

### 1.4 Graceful Degradation

When a language has fewer puzzles, show available count and a "More coming soon" badge. Don't hide languages â€” show progress even if content is limited.

## TASK 2: Premium Audio Learning Module (Pimsleur-Style)

This module relies on the Web Speech API for both Synthesis (TTS) and Recognition (STT). To feel premium, we disguise the robotic nature with **high-end visuals and strict pacing**.

### 2.1 Information Architecture & Navigation

- **Entry point:** A "Headphones" icon in the main navigation
- **Flow:** Lesson Select â†’ Audio Calibration â†’ Drill Interface â†’ Summary/Share

### 2.2 The "Zero Cost" Premium Audio Engine

We wrap `window.speechSynthesis` and `webkitSpeechRecognition`.

**Key Premium Tricks:**
- **Rate/Pitch Modulation:** Slow down the "Teacher" voice (`0.9x` speed) for clarity
- **Voice Selection:** Iterate through `window.speechSynthesis.getVoices()` and prefer "Google [Lang]", "Microsoft [Lang] Online", or "Samantha". Fallback to default only if necessary
- **The "Think" Sound:** Play a subtle soft click or ambient hum when the app is "listening" to mask the silence

### 2.3 The Visual Interface (Drill Mode)

The user should **NOT see the text initially**. They see a **Visualizer Orb** that communicates state.

**States:**
1. **Listen** (Teacher Speaking): Orb pulses gently in Primary Orange
2. **Thinking** (Pause): Orb contracts, turns to Secondary Cream
3. **Speak** (Mic Active): Orb expands, glows Forest Green, reacts to volume
4. **Process:** Spinning loader ring around orb
5. **Reveal:** Card fades in below with the text

**Component: `AudioDrillSession.tsx`**

```tsx
import React, { useState, useEffect, useRef } from 'react';
import { motion, AnimatePresence } from 'framer-motion';
import { Mic, MicOff, Volume2, ArrowRight } from 'lucide-react';

// --- Types ---
type DrillState = 'TEACHER_SPEAKING' | 'USER_THINKING' | 'USER_SPEAKING' | 'FEEDBACK_REVEAL';

interface AudioLessonProps {
  lessonData: {
    promptAudio: string; // Text to speak (Native)
    targetText: string;  // Text to learn (Target Lang)
  }[];
  voiceLang: string; // e.g., 'es-ES'
  onComplete: () => void;
}

export const AudioDrillSession = ({ lessonData, voiceLang, onComplete }: AudioLessonProps) => {
  const [currentIndex, setCurrentIndex] = useState(0);
  const [drillState, setDrillState] = useState<DrillState>('TEACHER_SPEAKING');
  const [transcript, setTranscript] = useState('');
  const [micPermission, setMicPermission] = useState<PermissionState>('prompt');
  
  // Refs for Web Speech API
  const synth = useRef<SpeechSynthesis>(window.speechSynthesis);
  const recognition = useRef<any>(null);

  // --- Logic: Sequence Controller ---
  useEffect(() => {
    playTeacherPrompt();
  }, [currentIndex]);

  const playTeacherPrompt = () => {
    setDrillState('TEACHER_SPEAKING');
    const item = lessonData[currentIndex];
    
    // 1. Speak Native Prompt (e.g., "Say: Where is the station?")
    const utterance = new SpeechSynthesisUtterance(item.promptAudio);
    utterance.lang = 'en-US'; // Teacher is always English (or user's native)
    utterance.rate = 1.0;
    utterance.onend = () => {
      // 2. Pause for thinking
      setDrillState('USER_THINKING');
      setTimeout(() => startListening(), 1500); // 1.5s thinking gap
    };
    synth.current.speak(utterance);
  };

  const startListening = () => {
    if (!window.webkitSpeechRecognition) return;
    
    setDrillState('USER_SPEAKING');
    recognition.current = new (window as any).webkitSpeechRecognition();
    recognition.current.lang = voiceLang;
    recognition.current.continuous = false;
    recognition.current.interimResults = true;

    recognition.current.onresult = (event: any) => {
      const current = event.resultIndex;
      const transcriptText = event.results[current][0].transcript;
      setTranscript(transcriptText);
    };

    recognition.current.onend = () => {
      // Automatically move to feedback after silence
      setDrillState('FEEDBACK_REVEAL');
      speakTargetAnswer();
    };

    recognition.current.start();
  };

  const speakTargetAnswer = () => {
    const item = lessonData[currentIndex];
    const utterance = new SpeechSynthesisUtterance(item.targetText);
    utterance.lang = voiceLang;
    utterance.rate = 0.9; // Slightly slower for clarity
    synth.current.speak(utterance);
  };

  const handleNext = () => {
    if (currentIndex < lessonData.length - 1) {
      setTranscript('');
      setCurrentIndex(c => c + 1);
    } else {
      onComplete();
    }
  };

  // --- UI Render ---
  return (
    <div className="flex flex-col items-center justify-between h-full max-w-lg mx-auto p-6 bg-background relative overflow-hidden">
      
      {/* 1. Progress Bar */}
      <div className="w-full flex gap-1 mb-8">
        {lessonData.map((_, idx) => (
          <div 
            key={idx}
            className={`h-1.5 flex-1 rounded-full transition-colors ${
              idx <= currentIndex ? 'bg-primary' : 'bg-surface'
            }`} 
          />
        ))}
      </div>

      {/* 2. Visualizer Orb (The "Premium" Feel) */}
      <div className="flex-1 flex flex-col items-center justify-center relative">
        <div className="relative w-64 h-64 flex items-center justify-center">
          
          {/* Background Ambient Glow */}
          <motion.div 
            animate={{ 
              scale: drillState === 'USER_SPEAKING' ? [1, 1.2, 1] : 1,
              opacity: drillState === 'USER_SPEAKING' ? 0.3 : 0.1
            }}
            transition={{ repeat: Infinity, duration: 2 }}
            className="absolute inset-0 bg-primary rounded-full blur-3xl"
          />

          {/* The Core Orb */}
          <motion.div
            animate={{
              scale: drillState === 'USER_SPEAKING' ? 1.2 : 1,
              backgroundColor: drillState === 'USER_SPEAKING' ? '#3E5641' : '#D36135',
            }}
            transition={{ type: "spring", stiffness: 200, damping: 20 }}
            className="w-32 h-32 rounded-full shadow-2xl flex items-center justify-center z-10 border-4 border-surface/50 backdrop-blur-md"
          >
            {drillState === 'TEACHER_SPEAKING' && <Volume2 className="text-secondary w-12 h-12" />}
            {drillState === 'USER_SPEAKING' && <Mic className="text-secondary w-12 h-12" />}
            {drillState === 'USER_THINKING' && (
              <motion.div 
                animate={{ rotate: 360 }}
                transition={{ repeat: Infinity, duration: 1, ease: "linear" }}
                className="w-12 h-12 border-4 border-secondary/30 border-t-secondary rounded-full"
              />
            )}
          </motion.div>
        </div>

        {/* 3. Text Reveal (Only shows in FEEDBACK state) */}
        <AnimatePresence mode="wait">
          {drillState === 'FEEDBACK_REVEAL' ? (
            <motion.div 
              initial={{ opacity: 0, y: 20 }}
              animate={{ opacity: 1, y: 0 }}
              exit={{ opacity: 0, y: -20 }}
              className="mt-8 text-center"
            >
              <h3 className="font-display text-3xl text-secondary mb-2">
                {lessonData[currentIndex].targetText}
              </h3>
              <p className="font-body text-secondary/60 text-sm">
                You said: <span className="italic">"{transcript}"</span>
              </p>
            </motion.div>
          ) : (
             <motion.p
              initial={{ opacity: 0 }}
              animate={{ opacity: 1 }}
              exit={{ opacity: 0 }}
              className="mt-8 font-body text-secondary/50 text-sm tracking-widest uppercase"
             >
               {drillState === 'USER_SPEAKING' ? 'Listening...' : 'Listen Carefully'}
             </motion.p>
          )}
        </AnimatePresence>
      </div>

      {/* 4. Controls */}
      <div className="w-full h-24 flex items-center justify-center">
        {drillState === 'FEEDBACK_REVEAL' && (
           <motion.button
             initial={{ scale: 0.8, opacity: 0 }}
             animate={{ scale: 1, opacity: 1 }}
             onClick={handleNext}
             className="w-full max-w-xs bg-secondary text-background font-body font-bold text-lg py-4 rounded-2xl shadow-lg hover:scale-105 active:scale-95 transition-transform flex items-center justify-center gap-2"
           >
             Continue <ArrowRight size={20} />
           </motion.button>
        )}
      </div>
    </div>
  );
};
```

## Integration: Funnel & Gamification

### How Audio Connects to Games

- **Unlock Logic:** Audio Lessons are "Premium". Free users get 1 per day. To unlock more, they play games to earn "Focus Points" (Soft Currency) or subscribe
- **Content Loop:** If a user struggles with "Food" words in the Daily Decode game, the Audio Module suggests a "Restaurant Ordering" lesson

### Share Card (Social Virality)

The share card must support non-Latin scripts elegantly.

```tsx
// Tailwind classes for the share card container
const shareCardClasses = "relative w-[320px] h-[480px] bg-background rounded-3xl overflow-hidden border border-secondary/10 flex flex-col p-6";

// Inside the card
<div className={shareCardClasses}>
  {/* Header */}
  <div className="flex items-center gap-2 mb-4">
    <div className="w-8 h-8 rounded-full bg-primary flex items-center justify-center font-display text-xs text-secondary">TL</div>
    <span className="font-display text-secondary/80">TutorLingua</span>
  </div>

  {/* Stat Big Number */}
  <div className="flex-1 flex flex-col justify-center items-center">
    <span className="font-display text-6xl text-primary drop-shadow-md mb-2">
      {score}
    </span>
    <span className="font-body text-secondary/60 uppercase tracking-widest text-xs">
      Streak Days
    </span>
  </div>

  {/* CJK Friendly Quote Area */}
  <div className="bg-surface/50 rounded-xl p-4 mb-4 backdrop-blur-sm border border-secondary/5">
     {/* Vertical Writing Mode for aesthetic CJK share cards */}
     <p className={`text-secondary text-lg text-center ${isCJK ? 'font-medium' : 'font-display'}`}>
       {learnedPhrase}
     </p>
  </div>
</div>
```

---

## Technical Constraints & Error Handling

- **Mobile Touch Targets:** All interactive elements (buttons, tiles) have a `min-h-[48px]` and `min-w-[48px]` touch area
- **Web Speech Fallbacks:**
  - If `window.speechSynthesis` is undefined (e.g., some in-app browsers), show an "Audio Unavailable" toast and switch to **Text-Only mode**
  - If Microphone is denied: Show a calm modal explaining that speaking is core to the experience, with a button to open Settings
- **Loading States:**
  - While loading voices (`speechSynthesis.getVoices` is async in Chrome), show a pulsing skeleton loader in the Audio Lesson Visualizer
